post_text:
Hotep Parents and Guardians,

Effective August 2017, as requested by the Pennsylvania Department of Health, all incoming 12th grade students must have a 2nd dose of MCV (meningococcal conjugate vaccine) by the 1st day of school, or risk exclusion from school until received. If your child's scheduled dose is after the 1st day of school, a signed medical plan from the physician or health district must be forwarded to admissions or school nurse..

Thank you,

School nurse
text:
Hotep Parents and Guardians,

If your child's scheduled dose is after the 1st day of school, a signed medical plan from the physician or health district must be forwarded to admissions or school nurse..

Thank you,

School nurse

post_text:
Middle School Transportation Update:
Since they did not give us early notification, the school district has decided to continue providing school bus services to 7th grade students, for school year 2017-2018. However, due to a district wide change, all eligible 8th grade general education students in the city of Philadelphia will receive a free SEPTA TransPass for the 2017-2018 school year.
text:
Middle School Transportation Update:
Since they did not give us early notification, the school district has decided to continue providing school bus services to 7th grade students, for school year 2017-2018. However, due to a district wide change, all eligible 8th grade general education students in the city of Philadelphia will receive a free SEPTA TransPass for the 2017-2018 school year.

post_text: The School District of Philadelphia recently notified us that 7th and 8th grade students, who live at least 1.5 miles away from the school, will receive a SEPTA TransPass, instead of being assigned to a school bus. Students in 7th and 8th grade are no longer eligible to ride the school bus. Please notify us if this affects your child's enrollment at Sankofa Freedom Academy Charter School. We appreciate your patience during this transition.
text: The School District of Philadelphia recently notified us that 7th and 8th grade students, who live at least 1.5 miles away from the school, will receive a SEPTA TransPass, instead of being assigned to a school bus. Students in 7th and 8th grade are no longer eligible to ride the school bus. Please notify us if this affects your child's enrollment at Sankofa Freedom Academy Charter School. We appreciate your patience during this transition.

post_text:
Hotep Family,

This is a reminder to take the Parent and Guardian survey, if you haven't done so yet. Take the survey by visiting www.philasd.org/parentsurvey. You can also visit the school's website (sfacs.us) for the survey link.

Contact the school to obtain your Child's Student ID number which is needed for the survey. Please take the survey for each of your children. If you don't have access to a computer, come to Sankofa and complete your survey in our computer lab.

By completing the survey, you will help keep Sankofa open so that we can continue to serve your children. Thanks so much for your support!

post_text: Your child was recently sent home with Yankee Candle fundraiser materials. Please keep in mind that all items in the brochure are taxable. You are responsible for including the taxes in your final sale price. A tax breakdown sheet has been included in your packet. Additionally, SFACS does not accept personal checks; this is a cash only sale. Thank you for participating in the Yankee Candle sale with the Wazuri (Parent Council). We appreciate your support.

NOTICES:

The Universoul Circus trip will take place on Wednesday, Nov. 9, 2016 - Tickets still available for $20.

The Wazuri (parent council) meeting, scheduled for Nov. 8, 2016, has been canceled, due to election day.

There will be a full day of school on Wednesday, November 16th. Report card conferences will take place from 4:30-7:30 p.m.

There will be an EARLY DISMISSAL on Thursday, November 17th, in preparation for our charter renewal.

November 21, 2016 is picture retake day for grades K-12.

The Board of Trustees meeting will take place on Monday, November 21, 2016, at 6:00 p.m.

HARVEST HOLIDAY - School will be closed from November 23rd - November 25th.

The School District of Philadelphia Parent & Guardian Survey has been launched and is available at the School District of Philadelphia's survey website: http://philasd.org/parentsurvey/

We ask that Sankofa Freedom Academy Parents take a few moments to complete this VERY important survey for EACH of your scholars. The Parent and Student Survey results will be a component of the 2016-2017 School Progress Report(SPR).

Deadline to complete the survey is June 27th. Please call the school to obtain your child's School District of Philadelphia Student ID Number. Thank you in advance for your cooperation.

post_text:
Hotep Family,
As a part of their SBA to HEKA project, the scholars of the Bambara have created an online petition on Change.org. They're asking us to support their campaign to end this epidemic of fight postings and bullying on various social media sites, including KIK, Instagram, Twitter, YouTube, Vine, and Facebook. We need 100 signatures, but I am certain that we can double that.

Would you support their efforts by clicking on the link below and signing their petition? We thank you so much for your support.

Mama Nikki Estrada
and the Nation of Bambara( Grade 6)

https://www.change.org/p/facebook-stop-the-posting-of-fight-videos-on-social-media?recruiter=538767788&utm_source=share_petition&utm_medium=copylink?recruiter=538767788&utm_source=petition_show&utm_medium=copylink
shared_text:
CHANGE.ORG
Facebook: Stop the Posting of Fight Videos on Social Media

Dmayne is already at 14 dozen Krispy Kreme donuts sold to help raise money for Sankofa Freedom Academy CS Parents! Who else wants to place an order? I am offering door to door deliveries! Deadline for orders is May 6th. And for those who are thinking of how many calories those donuts have and not wanting anything to interfere with summer goals, donate a dozen to your coworkers... it will definitely earn you some cool points in the office!

Hi Sankofa Parents,

The Wazuri (Parent Council) would like to show Sankofa teachers our appreciation by providing pastries, juice and coffee. In order for it to be successful, we are asking parents to donate $1 for each of their students. Each class teacher will collect the money from dates January 22 to February 5. The class with the highest participation will receive a dress down day pass.

Thank you,
Wazuri Parent Council Committee

• Remember the school number is 980 for closing due to weather or other emergencies. You can get the most current school closing information by listening to KYW Newsradio 1060 AM, calling the school closing line at 215-925-1060, or on the web at cbsphilly.com/schools.

• Join us on Fri., Feb. 19, 2016 for Family Movie Night! The Wazuri Parent Council will host this event from 6:30-8:30 pm in the gym. The movie is Minions and the cost is $2. Refreshments will be sold.

PHILADELPHIA.CBSLOCAL.COM
School Closings

Thank you for your support.

post_text: Sankofa Freedom Academy wants your Box Tops! These symbols can be found on many of the products you use every day. Clip the Box Tops and send them to school with your child. Our school will receive 10¢ for each Box Top your scholar turns in.

post_text:
Sankofa Freedom Academy Charter School is enrolled in Target's Take Charge of Education program! Our school can benefit from all of your Target purchases:
Target is on track to give $1 billion for education by the end of 2015. Talk about extra credit! Use the Credit or Debit REDcard, and Target will donate 1% of your Credit or Debit REDcard purchases made at Target and Target.com to help Sankofa Freedom Academy CS (School ID 153933).
Remember, Sankofa's TCOE School ID is 153933. Visit Target.com/TCOE to enroll or to switch your school to Sankofa Freedom Academy CS.

post_text: It’s that time of year again. We are inviting the entire school and family members to the Universoul Circus Friday, November 6th. Tickets are $15. We are only purchasing a certain amount of tickets, so they will be sold on a first come first served basis. The last payment will be accepted on November 2nd. We cannot set aside any tickets for anyone (no exceptions). In order to be consistent and orderly we will only accept payments in the Main Office from 7:30 am - 9:30 am. If money is sent with a student, the student must come to Main Office and submit their payment. Receipts will be given to everyone that makes a payment. PLEASE SAVE YOUR RECEIPT!! EVERYONE MUST PROVIDE THEIR RECEIPT THE DAY OF THE TRIP!! If you have any questions, please feel free to contact the Main Office. Thank you in advance for your cooperation.
